required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oral AZD8165 After Single Oral Ascending Doses in Healthy Male Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Single-center, Single-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Oral AZD8165 After Single Oral Ascending Doses in Healthy Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of AZD8165 and the pharmacokinetics of the metabolite AZ12971554 and plasma levels of the prodrug AZD8165 after escalating single oral low doses.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The study pharmacodynamic stopping criteria were met after the first dosing group

primary_outcome.measure: Safety variables (adverse events, Electrocardiograms, vital signs, safety labs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 64 days including a screening period, 3 treatment periods, 2 washout periods, and a follow-up period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma and urine levels of AZD8165 and its active metabolite AZ12971554
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Serial blood and urine samples will be taken over 24 hours after oral administration to evaluate AZD8165 and its active metabolite AZ12971554

secondary_outcome.measure: Coagulation times (namely Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time,Ecarin Clotting Time, Thrombin Clotting Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Serial blood samples will be taken over 24 hours after oral administration to evaluate Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (APTT), Ecarin clotting Time (ECT), Thrombin Clotting Time (TCT)

intervention.description: Oral suspension, 2 mg/mL and 20 mg/mL, single doses

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Suitable veins for cannulation or repeated venipuncture
- Have a body mass index (BMI) between 19 and 30 kg/m2 and weigh at least 50 kg and nor more than 100 kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of any clinically significancy disease or disorder which, in the opinion of the Investigator, may either put the volunteer at risk because of participation in the study, or influence the results or the volunteer's ability to participate in the study
- History or presence of gastrointestinal, hepatic or renal disease or any other condition known to interfere with absorption, distribution, metabolism or excretion of drugs
- Personal or family history of bleeding disorders, or reasonable suspicion of vascular malformations, including aneurysms.
